thread.title: Moving through Hawaii airports just got easier
thread.title_full: Moving through Hawaii airports just got easier

author: eTN Editor
title: Moving through Hawaii airports just got easier
text:
Moving through Hawaii airports just got easier Adv: 
Jul 16, 2015 Adv: 
Washington, DC – As if you needed a reason to be happier at a Hawaii airport, a bill was passed today by the US Senate Appropriations Committee that will make it easier for tourists to the Aloha State, as well as residents, to have a better airport experience as they move through the islands' terminals. 
Today, the Senate Appropriations Committee passed the agriculture appropriations bill for fiscal year 2016 that will increase funding by US$1 million for agricultural inspection stations like those at neighbor island airports, making it easier for travelers to move through the agricultural inspections process. 
“Without agricultural inspection stations at our neighbor island airports, tourists would be forced to claim the bags in Honolulu, get them inspected, and then recheck them before boarding their flights home,” said US Senator Schatz, a member of the Senate Appropriations Committee who worked to increase funding for the airport agricultural inspection stations. “This funding makes it easier to ensure visitors and residents alike have a better experience traveling through our airports.” 
Key funding in the agriculture appropriations bill includes US$27.9 million for Airport Agricultural Inspections. In Hawai‘i, this program funds federal agricultural inspectors at airports on Kauai, Maui, Oahu, and Hawai‘i Island. It is critical to conduct inspections at the neighbor island airports so that passengers can directly connect to flights to the mainland.
